ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: 1.Released more than 26,00,000 Olive Ridley baby turtles to sea. 2.Successfully satellite tagged 2 Olive Ridleys and 1 Green turtle becoming the first ever NGO in India to satellite-tag turtles. 3.Trained and developed a Sea Turtle Protection Force of over 316 members from 222 fishing villages. 4.More than 3750 officials have participated in State level workshops 5. 300000 students reached 6.100000 fishermen empowered 7. 827 turtles released form entangled nets 8. Tribals empowered

sourceOfFunds.purpose: In 2002, TREE Foundation became aware of the need for a community based sea turtle conservation program having learned that since the 1970s there has been a 90% reduction in the number of olive ridleys (vulnerable) nesting along coastal areas. Juvenile hawksbills (critically endangered) and green turtles (endangered) also forage in the region. There is an urgent need to protect ridley through a community based sea turtle conservation program along the east Coast of India.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Tribal Health Initiative was started on september 1993,By two medical doctors who were interested in tribal welfare. The base hospital at Sittilingi provides Out patients services and In patient services and catering to more than 8,000 tribal population .The hospital has well equipped labour unit and New bron unit and a surgical unit too. Health worker training: A major component of the hospital where tribal girls who have passed 8th std are trained in administering basic health services and treating minor ailments . Health Auxillary Training:The local community elderly women are trained peripheral health clinics:21 villages are covered and Pregnant women and under 5 age group children are covered. Tribal organic farming is implemented through farmers collective tribal crafts are encouraged among women and business units are developed thulir a supplementary school in building skills among children of tribals
